clinical_study.brief_title: Taxane Induced Peripheral Neuropathy in Chinese Patients With Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Taxane Induced Peripheral Neuropathy in Chinese Patients With Breast Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

clinical_study.source: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect clinical data, blood samples, and self reported symptoms of peripheral neuropathy from Chinese patients with breast cancer after treatment with taxanes. This data will be used to develop predictive markers for neuropathy.

primary_outcome.measure: Total score from the FACT-GOG-Ntx questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Total score from the FACT-GOG-Ntx questionnaire for peripheral neuropathy, ranging from 0-44,higher value represents a worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Predictive value of genetic variants for the development of neuropathy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the two weeks before start treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Total score from the EORTC QLQ - CIPN20 questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Total score from the EORTC QLQ - CIPN20 questionnaire for peripheral neuropathy, ranging from 20-80,higher value represents a worse outcome

arm_group.description: Patients with peripheral neuropathy after treatment with taxanes

Patients treated with taxanes and don't develop will be enrolled to this cohort and matched to a specified subject with neurotoxicity based on age, tumor stage, chemotherapy regimen or total taxane dosage

biospec_descr.textblock: Whole blood, DNA,Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMC)

study_pop.textblock: Chinese breast cancer patients treated with taxanes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of breast cancer
- Females aged 16 and older
- Planning to receive or previous treated with taxanes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Poorly controlled or insulin-dependent diabetes or other condition likely to predispose to neurotoxicity
